thread.title: Only In Bristol's first cast mates hope to rival Geordie Shore: 'We're fit and game for a f***ing laugh'
thread.title_full: Only In Bristol's first cast mates hope to rival Geordie Shore: 'We're fit and game for a f***ing laugh'

author: mirror
title: Only In Bristol's first cast mates hope to rival Geordie Shore: 'We're fit and game for a f***ing laugh'
text:
See a preview of Bristol's x-rated answer to Geordie Shore Share this video Watch Next 
Last week, an exclusive clip from the programme's casting was released. 
It featured 35 people auditioning and showed one would-be contestant dared to 'rub on' the person she finds most attractive in the house. 
We then see the fallout with some housemates not too impressed with their behaviour. X-rated scenes from the casting show some of the contestants misbehaving (Photo: Local World/ Bristol Post) Programmes makes have promised it will be even "bigger and better" than rivals (Photo: Local World/ Bristol Post) 
The team behind Only in Bristol are currently whittling down the applicants with the cast set to be announced next week before a pilot is filmed. 
D-Jukes says numerous TV companies have shown an interest in commissioning Only in Bristol which received 300 applications from people. 
"We had some great characters come forward. Some crazy, some freaky, some sexual and some promising drama," said D-Jukes. More than 300 people applied to take part in the casting (Photo: Local World/ Bristol Post) Contestants are aged 18 to 27 in the show (Photo: Local World/ Bristol Post) 
"We've got this one girl, who everyone keeps wanting out, but she keeps delivering drama like you wouldn't believe. 
"This show will be bigger and better than Geordie Shore." 
Only in Bristol will see the housemates set tasks with rewards and punishments on offer depending how they fare. Only In Bristol is due to film a pilot episode soon (Photo: Local World/ Bristol Post) Housemates are set tasks with rewards and punishments on offer (Photo: Local World/ Bristol Post) 
The contestants will have the power to vote off any housemates they don't like. 
They will also be looked after with a 'momma' character who will act as a shoulder to cry on. 
Jackass star Steve-O will also be a guest star. 
D-Jukes says: "I've found the whole experience really exciting and I can't wait for the public to see the show." Like us on Facebook
